abstract.text: A format style that creates string representations of date intervals.

legalNotices.copyright: Copyright © 2025 Apple Inc. All rights reserved.

inlineContent.text: Use a date interval format style to create user-readable strings in the form of
are date values that you supply. The format style uses locale and language information, along with custom formatting options, to define the content of the resulting string.
provides a variety of localized presets and configuration options to create user-visible representations of date intervals. When displaying a date interval to a user, use the
. Set the date and time styles of the date interval format style separately, according to your particular needs.
For example, to create a date interval string with a full date and no time representation, set the
. The following example creates a formatted interval string with this style:

code: if let today = Calendar.current.date(byAdding: .day, value: -120, to: Date()),
let thirtyDaysBeforeToday = Calendar.current.date(byAdding: .day, value: -30, to: today) {

inlineContent.text: You can create string representations of date intervals with various levels of brevity using a variety of preset date and time styles. The following example shows date styles of

code: if let today = Calendar.current.date(byAdding: .day, value: -120, to: Date()),
let thirtyDaysBeforeToday = Calendar.current.date(byAdding: .day, value: -30, to: today) {

inlineContent.text: and the default time style is
For full customization of the string representation of a date interval, use the

You can achieve any customization of date and time representation your app requires by appying a series of convenience modifiers to your format style. The following example applies a series of modifiers to the format style to precisely define the formatting of the year, month, day, hour, minute, and time zone components of the resulting string:

code: if let today = Calendar.current.date(byAdding: .day, value: -140, to: Date()),
let sevenDaysAfterToday = Calendar.current.date(byAdding: .day, value: 7, to: today) {
// Call the .formatted method on a Range<Date> and pass in an instance of Date.IntervalFormatStyle.

inlineContent.text: , to shorten the syntax when applying date and time modifiers to customize the format.

code: if let today = Calendar.current.date(byAdding: .day, value: -140, to: Date()),
let sevenDaysBeforeToday = Calendar.current.date(byAdding: .day, value: -7, to: today) {
// Call the .formatted method on a Range<Date> and pass in an instance of Date.IntervalFormatStyle.
// We, February 3, 3 PM – We, February 10, 3 PM
// พ. 3 กุมภาพันธ์ 15 – พ. 10 กุมภาพันธ์ 15
// me 3 février, 15 h – me 10 février, 15 h

abstract.text: A specific point in time, independent of any calendar or time zone.
Generates a locale-aware string representation of a date using the ISO 8601 date format.
Generates a locale-aware string representation of a date using the specified date format style.
Generates a locale-aware string representation of a date using specified date and time format styles.
Generates a locale-aware string representation of a date using the default date format style.
A structure that creates a locale-appropriate string representation of a date instance and converts strings of dates and times into date instances.
A format style that creates string representations of date intervals.
Returns a Boolean value indicating whether two values are not equal.
Returns a Boolean value that indicates whether two values are equal.
The calendar for formatting the date interval.
Modifies the date interval format style to include the day.
Encodes the value into the specified encoder.
Hashes the essential components of the value by feeding them into the specified hasher.
The hash value of the style format.
Modifies the date interval format style to use the specified hour format style.
Creates an instance using the provided date, time, locale, calendar, time zone, and capitalization context.
Creates an instance by decoding from the specified decoder.
The locale for formatting the date and time interval components.
Modifies the date interval format style to include the minutes.
Modifies the date interval format style to include the month.
Modifies the date interval format style to include the seconds.
The time zone for formatting the date interval components.
Modifies the date interval format style to use the specified time zone format.
Modifies the date interval format style to include the year.
Creates a locale-aware string representation from a relative date value.
A convenience factory variable to use as a base for custom date interval format styles.
Modifies the date interval format style to use the specified locale.
Modifies the date interval format style to include the specified weekday style.
The type that defines date interval styles that vary in length or in their included components.
The type of data to format.
The type of the formatted data.
The type that supports customizing formatting templates using the date format style’s modifier functions, and constructing fixed-pattern date format strings.
The type that defines time styles that vary in length or in their included components.
A type that converts between dates and their ISO-8601 string representations.
A format style that forms locale-aware string representations of a relative date or time.
